{"step_by_step_thinking": "Mouth breathing is a type of abnormal breathing pattern where the individual breathes through their mouth instead of their nose. It is often seen in individuals with certain types of cerebral palsy. Athetoid cerebral palsy is characterized by uncontrolled, slow, writhing movements. Spastic cerebral palsy is characterized by muscle stiffness and movement difficulties. Ataxic cerebral palsy is characterized by problems with balance and coordination. Mixed type cerebral palsy is a combination of the above types.
